issue.title: Warnings about invalid configuration only appear once per session

repository.name: starship
repository.description: ‚òÑüååÔ∏è  The minimal, blazing-fast, and infinitely customizable prompt for any shell!

issue.body:
#### Current Behavior When something causes the config to be invalid, the warning regarding it only displays the first time it is encountered. The screenshot above employs the following two config files: `~/.config/starship.working.toml` (also `~/.config/starship.toml` at the beginning) ```toml format = 'Hello! $character' [shell] disabled = false ``` `~/.config/starship.broken.toml` ```toml format = 'Hello! $character' # This should be "golang". [go] disabled = true [shell] disabled = false ``` #### Expected Behavior A warning is emitted every time an invalid configuration is encountered. #### Additional context/Screenshots I haven't looked through the code for this, but it seems like something that could be intentional (e.g. to avoid spamming the user with warnings). Even if so, however, I feel that failing to print a warning causes more problems than it might solve. In my case, I was setting up Starship for the first time, misread the config page, and created a `[go]` section instead of a `[golang]` section. This caused my top-level `format=` to be ignored (see #4481), which I then spent over an hour debugging because I missed the initial warning about the `[go]` section and happened never to open another terminal window. üò≠
Worse, the warning doesn't show up when running STARSHIP_LOG=trace starship explain. ```text [TRACE] - (starship): Parsed arguments: Cli { command: Explain( Properties { status_code: None, pipestatus: None, terminal_width: 158, path: None, logical_path: None, cmd_duration: None, keymap: "viins", jobs: 0, }, ), } [DEBUG] - (starship::config): STARSHIP_CONFIG is not set [DEBUG] - (starship::config): Using default config path: /Users/bblank/.config/starship.toml [TRACE] - (starship::utils): Trying to read from "/Users/bblank/.config/starship.toml" [TRACE] - (starship::utils): File read successfully [TRACE] - (starship::config): Config file content: " format = 'Hello! $character' # This should be "golang". [go] disabled = true [shell] disabled = false " [DEBUG] - (starship::config): Config parsed: Table({"format": String("Hello! $character"), "go": Table({"disabled": Boolean(true)}), "shell": Table({"disabled": Boolean(false)})}) [TRACE] - (starship::context): Received completed pipestatus of None [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "username": Option "username" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "username": Option "username" not found [TRACE] - (starship::modules): Took 29.256¬µs to compute module "username" [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "hostname": Option "hostname" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "hostname": Option "hostname" not found [TRACE] - (starship::modules): Took 21.17¬µs to compute module "hostname" [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "localip": Option "localip" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "localip": Option "localip" not found [TRACE] - (starship::modules): Took 18.749¬µs to compute module "localip" [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "shlvl": Option "shlvl" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "shlvl": Option "shlvl" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "kubernetes": Option "kubernetes" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "kubernetes": Option "kubernetes" not found [TRACE] - (starship::modules): Took 17.876¬µs to compute module "kubernetes" [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "directory": Option "directory" not found [TRACE] - (starship::config): No config found for "directory": Option "directory" not found [DEBUG] - (starship::modules::directory): Home dir: "/Users/bblank" [DEBUG] - #### Environment - Starship version: 1.10.3 - bash version: GNU bash, version 3.2.57(1)-release (x86_64-apple-darwin21) Copyright (C) 2007 Free Software Foundation, Inc. - Operating system: Mac OS 12.6.0 - Terminal emulator: iTerm.app 3.4.16 - Git Commit Hash: - Branch/Tag: - Rust Version: rustc 1.63.0 - Rust channel: release - Build Time: 2022-09-08 17:00:06 +00:00 #### Relevant Shell Configuration ```bash export BASH_SILENCE_DEPRECATION_WARNING=1 export EDITOR=$(which nano) export HISTIGNORE="&" export PATH=$HOME/bin:/usr/local/bin:$PATH [ -f /usr/local/etc/bash_completion ] && . /usr/local/etc/bash_completion eval "$(starship init bash)" ``` #### Starship Configuration ```toml format = 'Hello! $character' [shell] disabled = false ```

issue.title: fix(config): unrecognized config properties don't cause config error

repository.name: starship
repository.description: ‚òÑüååÔ∏è  The minimal, blazing-fast, and infinitely customizable prompt for any shell!

issue.body: Fixes an issue where the config was not being loaded when ignored properties are present. This still prints a warning log indicating a possible misconfiguration. #### Description ~~The deserializer wrapper has been updated such that deserialization of ignored properties does not return an error, and instead returns the `visitor.visit_none()`. This function now includes a warning log statement since the [log statement for reporting the error](https://github.com/starship/starship/blob/master/src/config.rs#L34) as shown in the bug ticket is no longer reached.~~ (this described the initial implementation before PR review) The `ValueDeserializer` wrapper has been updated so that warnings can be either ignored or cause an `Err` result. At this time, the only warning that gets emitted is the warning from ignored properties during deserialization. This can be used via the new `with_allow_unknown_keys` function. The configurable warning behavior is used within the generic `from_config` implementation of `ModuleConfig`, wherein the deserializer wrapper is used to load the config. If it reports an "Unknown key" error, then the config is loaded again and deserialized without reporting warnings. This results in the warning be reported without preventing the otherwise valid config being loaded and returned. #### Motivation and Context Closes #4481 #### Screenshots (if appropriate): In this screenshot, I'm showing that as I initialize starship with these changes, we can see I have not set a custom format (the line in the config is commented out), and the unexpected property "go" is detected and a warning is printed. After updating the config to enable the format using `sed`, the shell format is updated with the new prompt without resolving the unexpected config field. #### How Has This Been Tested? - [x] I have tested using **MacOS** - [ ] I have tested using **Linux** - [ ] I have tested using **Windows** 1. set `~/.config/starship.toml` with an unexpected key like the following: ```toml format = 'Hello! $character' # This should be "golang". [go] disabled = true [shell] disabled = false ``` 2. re-initialize starship using the build with `eval "$(cargo run init zsh)"` (I'm using `zsh`, but the shell type doesn't matter in this case) 3. Expect to see the prompt "Hello!" rather than the default shell name (in my case `zsh ‚ùØ` #### Checklist: - [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly. **(n/a)** - [x] I have updated the tests accordingly.
